name: commandingly
content:
commandingly adverb
(WITH AUTHORITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows authority and control, and therefore demands attention: "Stay there," Ben said commandingly. The minister was commandingly tall and inspiring.
More examplesFewer examplesHe crossed the lobby briskly and commandingly, head up, eyes forward.She delivered a commandingly intense performance.He is a commandingly intelligent man.

commandingly adverb
(WINNING EASILY)
in a way that shows someone is much better than everyone else: The Olympic champion won commandingly, leaving her rivals far behind. They can still win, but not as commandingly as they did last season.
More examplesFewer examplesThe four-mile contest was won commandingly by a remarkable thoroughbred.He qualified commandingly in pole position, and seems to be heading towards his fifth Grand Prix victory in a row.
